elements.title: Munich kitchen
elements.contents: ... that the Munich kitchen was developed because the Stuttgart kitchen (example pictured) did not allow a housewife to look after her children?

elements.title: Juan Álvarez
elements.contents: ... that football manager Juan Álvarez was nicknamed the "king without a crown" after his team lost a championship due to the away goals rule?

elements.title: her 1953–1954 tour of the country
elements.contents: ... that an estimated three-quarters of New Zealand's population saw Elizabeth II during her 1953–1954 tour of the country?

elements.title: Thomas Lincoln Tally
elements.contents: ... that Thomas Lincoln Tally, considered the pioneer movie-theater exhibitor of Los Angeles in 1916, is credited with coining the term "moving picture"?

elements.title: Os Trombadinhas
elements.contents: ... that a line delivered by Pelé in the 1980 movie Os Trombadinhas went viral as a meme in Brazil?

elements.title: Perdiccas
elements.contents: ... that a Roman historian reported that Perdiccas, Alexander the Great's regent after his death, was nominated as king with great support, but hesitated to accept the role?

elements.title: Magical Girl Witch Trials
elements.contents: ... that Magical Girl Witch Trials received full voice acting after crowdfunding raised more than 30 times the original goal?

elements.title: Edgewood
elements.contents: ... that when Edgewood was built in Stanleytown, Virginia, its Greek Revival style was unknown to most people in the area?

elements.title: Shunsaku Tamiya
elements.contents: ... that toy designer Shunsaku Tamiya was placed under government surveillance for speaking to Soviets about their tanks?
